version_description:
- We heard your feedback, and comments write, flag, and recommend are back!

- Concerned about data usage? Only your top 10 sections will be downloaded for offline reading. To change your Top Sections, press and drag your favorite sections into your

- We’ve made some optimizations to ensure that the app loads reliably on all devices.
- Addressed some crashes and added some polish.

- Looking for an article you just read? The Recently Viewed section is back! Simply log in to see a list of the articles you’ve been reading.
- If you leave an article before you finish reading it, the app will now remember where you left off when you

• Added support for iPhone X.
• We now have captions on some videos, and will be adding more each week. If you see the “CC” icon on a video, tap it to turn captions on.
• Now you can listen to some of our most popular podcasts, like The Daily, in th
- We fixed a crash and a few bugs.

- We added support for rich notifications on iOS 10+. Long press on a notification to see larger images and a detail view.
- If your device supports 3D touch, you can use it to access Top Stories, The Mini Crossword, your saved articles, and the Most
- Fixes for battery issues, especially on plus devices and iPhone X.

- Added some polish to the in-app audio player.
- Bug fixes

- Bug fixes and polish.
- Oh... and we snuck in support for augmented reality. Update your app and stay tuned for what’s coming next!
Polish and bug fixes.

• We’ve added a feature that lets you decide whether or not you want to download section front photos to control how much data the app uses. Go into Settings > Data Usage, and toggle “Download Images” off if you would like to try it out.
• We’re al

- Resolved the issue that prevented some people from saving recipes to their Recipe Boxes. If you’re still having trouble saving to your recipe box after updating, try logging out of the app and back in.

- We made improvements to the augmented real

- We fixed a bug that made some shared article links unresponsive. If you’re still having issues after updating the app, please let us know at ios@nytimes.com.
- Added support for Smart Invert Colors.
- Made some design refinements and performance e

- We’ve addressed the issue that caused ads to cover text for some users. If you’re still encountering this bug, please email us from within the app.
- Notification preferences are now accessible from the Settings menu.
- Small bug fixes and perform
Performance enhancements and bug fixes.

- We resolved the issue that prevented some users from opening the Mini Crossword.
- We fixed the bug that caused the app to improperly display an article on launch after backgrounding the app from a section front.

- We fixed the bug that prevented some articles from opening offline.
- Resolved the issue that prevented some users from opening the Mini Crossword.
- We fixed the bug that caused the app to improperly display an article on launch after backgroundi

• We’ve added a feature that lets you decide whether or not you want to download section front photos to control how much data the app uses. Go into Settings > Data Usage, and toggle “Download Images” off if you would like to try it out.
• We’re al

• Small bug fixes and performance enhancements.
• We’re always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback. Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com

• We’ve added a feature that lets you decide whether or not you want to download section front photos to control how much data the app uses. Go into Settings > Data Usage, and toggle “Download Images” off if you would like to try it out.

• We’re always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback. Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com

• Visit the Today’s Paper section to get caught up on all of the articles in the day’s print edition of The Times. Tap and drag the section into your Top Sections to make it available offline.
• Our award winning video content will now play automatical

• We fixed a bug that caused issues with articles appearing on section fronts for some iPads.
• We’re always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback. Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com

• MinWe’ve updated the design of Top Stories to provide a more consistent experience across all of our apps and our website. Our new home page groups similar stories together so you can easily return to sections that interest you, again and again.

• We’ve added an easier way to find and follow topics in the Your Feed feature.
• We’re always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback. Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com

In this version we fixed some visual bugs and continued to improve the app's performance.
Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com

In this version we continued fixing minor bugs, and enhanced the app's performance.
Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com
We’re always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback. Have questions or concerns? Send us an email at iOS@nytimes.com

In this version we will be bringing you more of our interactive and immersive storytelling, directly on your home feed.
Please share any feedback, comment or issue by reaching out at iOS@nytimes.com

In this version, we continued on working improving the app's performance, as well as enhancing some visual aspects.
Please share any feedback at iOS@nytimes.com

We are releasing a tabbed navigation to a portion of our audience and we will continue to roll this out over time. If you don't see it right away, it's still in test mode but it will reach your device soon!

In this version we continued adding improvements and tweaks to the new tabbed navigation.

As usual, we’re always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback at iOS@nytimes.com.

In this version we focused on "behind the scenes" upgrades that will improve the app's performance on your device.

As usual, we're always working on improving the app, and would love to hear your feedback at iOS@nytimes.com.

In this version we introduce upgrades that will improve the content-loading speed and quality.
We also fixed minor bugs and fine-tuned some features.
Let us know what you think at ios@nytimes.com

In this version we've continued to rollout the tabbed navigation to more devices, now to a majority of you, thank you for your patience!
Let us know what you think at ios@nytimes.com
This version includes updates and improvements to make your experience better. Please provide any feedback or questions at: ios@nytimes.com.

In this version we stared cleaning up the look & feel of the Top Stories section. More exciting improvements to come.
Reach out to: ios@nytimes.com with any question, comment or feedback.

Need help? Now you can choose the new "Text Us" option from For You > Settings > Support.

For any other question, feedback or concern please reach out to: ios@nytimes.com.

General bug fixes and improvements.

For any other questions, concerns or general feedback please reach out to ios@nytimes.com.

In this version we fixed minor bugs and introduced performance improvements.

For any question, concern or general feedback please reach out to ios@nytimes.com.

In this version we've updated "For You" so it's easier to find the stories you're most interested in and keep up with your favorite briefings, games, podcasts and more.

For any question or feedback please reach out to ios@nytimes.com.
